verses.verse: "And in the first <S%H259><s%> year <S%H8141><s%> of Darius <S%H1867><s%> the Mede, <S%H4075><s%> I arose <S%H5975><s%> to be an encouragement <S%H2388><s%> and a protection <S%H4581><s%> for him.

"And now <S%H6258><s%> I will tell <S%H5046><s%> you the truth. <S%H571><s%> Behold, <S%H2009><s%> three <S%H7969><s%> more <S%H5750><s%> kings <S%H4428><s%> are going to arise <S%H5975><s%> in Persia. <S%H6539><s%> Then a fourth <S%H7243><s%> will gain <S%H6238><s%> far <S%H1419><s%> more <S%H1419><s%> riches <S%H6239><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> [of them;] as soon as he becomes strong <S%H2393><s%> through his riches, <S%H6239><s%> he will arouse <S%H5782><s%> the whole <S%H3605><s%> [empire] against the realm <S%H4438><s%> of Greece. <S%H3120><s%>

"And a mighty <S%H1368><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> will arise, <S%H5975><s%> and he will rule <S%H4910><s%> with great <S%H7227><s%> authority <S%H4474><s%> and do <S%H6213><s%> as he pleases. <S%H7522><s%>

"But as soon as he has arisen, <S%H5975><s%> his kingdom <S%H4438><s%> will be broken <S%H7665><s%> up and parceled <S%H2673><s%> out toward the four <S%H702><s%> points <S%H7307><s%> of the compass, <S%H8064><s%> though not to his [own] descendants, <S%H319><s%> nor <S%H3808><s%> according to his authority <S%H4915><s%> which <S%H834><s%> he wielded; <S%H4910><s%> for his sovereignty <S%H4438><s%> will be uprooted <S%H5428><s%> and [given] to others <S%H312><s%> besides <S%H4480><s%> <S%H905><s%> them.

"Then the king <S%H4428><s%> of the South <S%H5045><s%> will grow <S%H2388><s%> strong, <S%H2388><s%> along with [one] of his princes <S%H8269><s%> who will gain <S%H2388><s%> ascendancy <S%H2388><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> him and obtain <S%H4910><s%> dominion; <S%H4910><s%> his domain <S%H4475><s%> [will be] a great <S%H7227><s%> dominion <S%H4475><s%> [indeed].

"And after <S%H7093><s%> some years <S%H8141><s%> they will form <S%H2266><s%> an alliance, <S%H2266><s%> and the daughter <S%H1323><s%> of the king <S%H4428><s%> of the South <S%H5045><s%> will come <S%H935><s%> to the king <S%H4428><s%> of the North <S%H6828><s%> to carry <S%H6213><s%> out a peaceful <S%H4339><s%> arrangement. <S%H4339><s%> But she will not retain <S%H6113><s%> her position <S%H2220><s%> of power, <S%H3581><s%> nor <S%H3808><s%> will he remain <S%H5975><s%> with his power, <S%H2220><s%> but she will be given <S%H5414><s%> up, along with those who brought <S%H935><s%> her in, and the one who sired <S%H3205><s%> her, as well as he who supported <S%H2388><s%> her in [those] times. <S%H6256><s%>

"But one of the descendants <S%H5342><s%> of her line <S%H8328><s%> will arise <S%H5975><s%> in his place, <S%H3653><s%> and he will come <S%H935><s%> against <S%H413><s%> [their] army <S%H2428><s%> and enter <S%H935><s%> the fortress <S%H4581><s%> of the king <S%H4428><s%> of the North, <S%H6828><s%> and he will deal <S%H6213><s%> with them and display <S%H2388><s%> [great] strength. <S%H2388><s%>

"And also <S%H1571><s%> their gods <S%H430><s%> with their metal <S%H9331><s%> images <S%H9331><s%> [and] their precious <S%H2532><s%> vessels <S%H3627><s%> of silver <S%H3701><s%> and gold <S%H2091><s%> he will take <S%H935><s%> into captivity <S%H7628><s%> to Egypt, <S%H4714><s%> and he on his part <S%H1931><s%> will refrain <S%H5975><s%> from [attacking] the king <S%H4428><s%> of the North <S%H6828><s%> for [some] years. <S%H8141><s%>
"Then the latter will enter <S%H935><s%> the realm <S%H4438><s%> of the king <S%H4428><s%> of the South, <S%H5045><s%> but will return <S%H7725><s%> to his [own] land. <S%H127><s%>

"And his sons <S%H1121><s%> will mobilize <S%H1624><s%> and assemble <S%H622><s%> a multitude <S%H1995><s%> of great <S%H7227><s%> forces; <S%H2428><s%> and one of them will keep <S%H935><s%> on coming <S%H935><s%> and overflow <S%H7857><s%> and pass <S%H5674><s%> through, <S%H5674><s%> that he may again <S%H7725><s%> wage <S%H1624><s%> war <S%H1624><s%> up to his [very] fortress. <S%H4581><s%>

"And the king <S%H4428><s%> of the South <S%H5045><s%> will be enraged <S%H4843><s%> and go <S%H3318><s%> forth <S%H3318><s%> and fight <S%H3898><s%> with the king <S%H4428><s%> of the North. <S%H6828><s%> Then the latter will raise <S%H5975><s%> a great <S%H7227><s%> multitude, <S%H1995><s%> but [that] multitude <S%H1995><s%> will be given <S%H5414><s%> into the hand <S%H3027><s%> of the [former].

"When the multitude <S%H1995><s%> is carried <S%H5375><s%> away, his heart <S%H3824><s%> will be lifted <S%H7311><s%> up, and he will cause tens <S%H7239><s%> of thousands <S%H7239><s%> to fall; <S%H5307><s%> yet he will not prevail. <S%H5810><s%>

"For the king <S%H4428><s%> of the North <S%H6828><s%> will again <S%H7725><s%> raise <S%H5975><s%> a greater <S%H7227><s%> multitude <S%H1995><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> the former, <S%H7223><s%> and after <S%H7093><s%> an interval <S%H7093><s%> <S%H6256><s%> of some <S%H6256><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> he will press <S%H935><s%> on with a great <S%H1419><s%> army <S%H2428><s%> and much <S%H7227><s%> equipment. <S%H7399><s%>

"Now in those <S%H1992><s%> times <S%H6256><s%> many <S%H7227><s%> will rise <S%H5975><s%> up against <S%H5921><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%> of the South; <S%H5045><s%> the violent <S%H6530><s%> ones <S%H1121><s%> <S%H6530><s%> among your people <S%H5971><s%> will also lift <S%H5375><s%> themselves up in order to fulfill <S%H5975><s%> the vision, <S%H2377><s%> but they will fall <S%H3782><s%> down. <S%H3782><s%>

"Then the king <S%H4428><s%> of the North <S%H6828><s%> will come, <S%H935><s%> cast <S%H8210><s%> up a siege <S%H5550><s%> mound, <S%H5550><s%> and capture <S%H3920><s%> a well-fortified city; <S%H5892><s%> and the forces <S%H2220><s%> of the South <S%H5045><s%> will not stand <S%H5975><s%> [their ground,] not even their choicest <S%H4005><s%> troops, <S%H5971><s%> for there <S%H369><s%> will be no <S%H369><s%> strength <S%H3581><s%> to make <S%H5975><s%> a stand. <S%H5975><s%>

"But he who comes <S%H935><s%> against <S%H413><s%> him will do <S%H6213><s%> as he pleases, <S%H7522><s%> and no <S%H369><s%> one <S%H369><s%> will [be able to] withstand <S%H6440><s%> <S%H5975><s%> him; he will also stay <S%H5975><s%> [for a time] in the Beautiful <S%H9469><s%> Land, <S%H776><s%> with destruction <S%H3617><s%> in his hand. <S%H3027><s%>

"And he will set <S%H7760><s%> his face <S%H6440><s%> to come <S%H935><s%> with the power <S%H8633><s%> of his whole <S%H3605><s%> kingdom, <S%H4438><s%> bringing with him a proposal <S%H3477><s%> of peace <S%H3477><s%> which he will put <S%H6213><s%> into effect; <S%H6213><s%> he will also give <S%H5414><s%> him the daughter <S%H1323><s%> of women <S%H802><s%> to ruin <S%H7843><s%> it. But she will not take <S%H5975><s%> a stand <S%H5975><s%> [for him] or be on his side.

"Then he will turn <S%H7725><s%> his face <S%H6440><s%> to the coastlands <S%H339><s%> and capture <S%H3920><s%> many. <S%H7227><s%> But a commander <S%H7101><s%> will put <S%H7673><s%> a stop <S%H7673><s%> to his scorn <S%H2781><s%> against him; moreover, <S%H1115><s%> he will repay <S%H7725><s%> him for his scorn. <S%H2781><s%>

"So he will turn <S%H7725><s%> his face <S%H6440><s%> toward the fortresses <S%H4581><s%> of his own land, <S%H776><s%> but he will stumble <S%H3782><s%> and fall <S%H5307><s%> and be found <S%H4672><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> more.

"Then in his place <S%H3653><s%> one will arise <S%H5975><s%> who will send <S%H5674><s%> an oppressor <S%H5065><s%> through <S%H5674><s%> the Jewel <S%H1925><s%> of [his] kingdom; <S%H4438><s%> yet within a few <S%H259><s%> days <S%H3117><s%> he will be shattered, <S%H7665><s%> though neither <S%H3808><s%> in anger <S%H639><s%> nor <S%H3808><s%> in battle. <S%H4421><s%>

"And in his place <S%H3653><s%> a despicable <S%H959><s%> person will arise, <S%H5975><s%> on whom the honor <S%H1935><s%> of kingship <S%H4438><s%> has not been conferred, <S%H5414><s%> but he will come <S%H935><s%> in a time <S%H7962><s%> of tranquility <S%H7962><s%> and seize <S%H2388><s%> the kingdom <S%H4438><s%> by intrigue. <S%H2519><s%>

"And the overflowing <S%H7858><s%> forces <S%H2220><s%> will be flooded <S%H7857><s%> away <S%H7857><s%> before <S%H4480><s%> <S%H6440><s%> him and shattered, <S%H7665><s%> and also <S%H1571><s%> the prince <S%H5057><s%> of the covenant. <S%H1285><s%>

"And after <S%H4480><s%> an alliance <S%H2266><s%> is made <S%H2266><s%> with him he will practice <S%H6213><s%> deception, <S%H4820><s%> and he will go <S%H5927><s%> up and gain <S%H6105><s%> power <S%H6105><s%> with a small <S%H4592><s%> [force of] people. <S%H1471><s%>

"In a time <S%H7962><s%> of tranquility <S%H7962><s%> he will enter <S%H935><s%> the richest <S%H9304><s%> [parts] of the realm, <S%H4082><s%> and he will accomplish <S%H6213><s%> what <S%H834><s%> his fathers never <S%H1><s%> did, <S%H3808><s%> nor <S%H6213><s%> his ancestors; he will distribute <S%H3808><s%> plunder, <S%H1><s%> booty, <S%H967><s%> and possessions <S%H961><s%> among them, and he will devise <S%H7998><s%> his schemes <S%H7399><s%> against <S%H2803><s%> strongholds, <S%H4284><s%> but [only] for a time. <S%H5921><s%>

"And he will stir <S%H5782><s%> up his strength <S%H3581><s%> and courage <S%H3824><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%> of the South <S%H5045><s%> with a large <S%H1419><s%> army; <S%H2428><s%> so the king <S%H4428><s%> of the South <S%H5045><s%> will mobilize <S%H1624><s%> an extremely <S%H5704><s%> <S%H3966><s%> large <S%H1419><s%> and mighty <S%H6099><s%> army <S%H2428><s%> for war; <S%H4421><s%> but he will not stand, <S%H5975><s%> for schemes <S%H4284><s%> will be devised <S%H2803><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> him.

"And those who eat <S%H398><s%> his choice <S%H6598><s%> food <S%H6598><s%> will destroy <S%H7665><s%> him, and his army <S%H2428><s%> will overflow, <S%H7857><s%> but many <S%H7227><s%> will fall <S%H5307><s%> down <S%H5307><s%> slain. <S%H2491><s%>

"As for both <S%H8147><s%> kings, <S%H4428><s%> their hearts <S%H3824><s%> will be [intent] on evil, <S%H7489><s%> and they will speak <S%H1696><s%> lies <S%H3577><s%> [to each other] at the same <S%H259><s%> table; <S%H7979><s%> but it will not succeed, <S%H6743><s%> for the end <S%H7093><s%> is still <S%H5750><s%> [to come] at the appointed <S%H4150><s%> time. <S%H4150><s%>

"Then he will return <S%H7725><s%> to his land <S%H776><s%> with much <S%H1419><s%> plunder; <S%H7399><s%> but his heart <S%H3824><s%> will be [set] against <S%H5921><s%> the holy <S%H6944><s%> covenant, <S%H1285><s%> and he will take <S%H6213><s%> action <S%H6213><s%> and [then] return <S%H7725><s%> to his [own] land. <S%H776><s%>

"At the appointed <S%H4150><s%> time <S%H4150><s%> he will return <S%H7725><s%> and come <S%H935><s%> into the South, <S%H5045><s%> but this last <S%H314><s%> time <S%H314><s%> it will not turn <S%H1961><s%> out the way it did before. <S%H7223><s%>

"For ships <S%H6716><s%> of Kittim <S%H3794><s%> will come <S%H935><s%> against him; therefore he will be disheartened, <S%H3512><s%> and will return <S%H7725><s%> and become <S%H2194><s%> enraged <S%H2194><s%> at the holy <S%H6944><s%> covenant <S%H1285><s%> and take <S%H6213><s%> action; <S%H6213><s%> so he will come <S%H7725><s%> back <S%H7725><s%> and show <S%H995><s%> regard <S%H995><s%> for those who forsake <S%H5800><s%> the holy <S%H6944><s%> covenant. <S%H1285><s%>

"And forces <S%H2220><s%> from him will arise, <S%H5975><s%> desecrate <S%H2490><s%> the sanctuary <S%H4720><s%> fortress, <S%H4581><s%> and do <S%H5493><s%> away <S%H5493><s%> with the regular <S%H8548><s%> sacrifice. <S%H8548><s%> And they will set <S%H5414><s%> up the abomination <S%H8251><s%> of desolation. <S%H8074><s%>

"And by smooth <S%H2514><s%> [words] he will turn <S%H2610><s%> to godlessness <S%H2610><s%> those who act <S%H7561><s%> wickedly <S%H7561><s%> toward the covenant, <S%H1285><s%> but the people <S%H5971><s%> who know <S%H3045><s%> their God <S%H430><s%> will display <S%H2388><s%> strength <S%H2388><s%> and take <S%H6213><s%> action. <S%H6213><s%>

"And those who have <S%H7919><s%> insight <S%H7919><s%> among the people <S%H5971><s%> will give <S%H995><s%> understanding <S%H995><s%> to the many; <S%H7227><s%> yet they will fall <S%H3782><s%> by sword <S%H2719><s%> and by flame, <S%H3852><s%> by captivity <S%H7628><s%> and by plunder, <S%H961><s%> for [many] days. <S%H3117><s%>
"Now when they fall <S%H3782><s%> they will be granted <S%H5826><s%> a little <S%H4592><s%> help, <S%H5828><s%> and many <S%H7227><s%> will join <S%H3867><s%> with them in hypocrisy. <S%H2519><s%>

"And some <S%H4480><s%> of those who have <S%H7919><s%> insight <S%H7919><s%> will fall, <S%H3782><s%> in order to refine, <S%H6884><s%> purge, <S%H1305><s%> and make <S%H3835><s%> them pure, <S%H3835><s%> until <S%H5704><s%> the end <S%H7093><s%> time; <S%H6256><s%> because <S%H3588><s%> [it is] still <S%H5750><s%> [to come] at the appointed <S%H4150><s%> time. <S%H4150><s%>

"Then the king <S%H4428><s%> will do <S%H6213><s%> as he pleases, <S%H7522><s%> and he will exalt <S%H7311><s%> and magnify <S%H1431><s%> himself above <S%H5921><s%> every <S%H3605><s%> god, <S%H410><s%> and will speak <S%H1696><s%> monstrous <S%H6381><s%> things <S%H6381><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> the God <S%H410><s%> of gods; <S%H410><s%> and he will prosper <S%H6743><s%> until <S%H5704><s%> the indignation <S%H2195><s%> is finished, <S%H3615><s%> for that which is decreed <S%H2782><s%> will be done. <S%H6213><s%>

"And he will show <S%H995><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> regard <S%H995><s%> for the gods <S%H430><s%> of his fathers or for the desire <S%H1><s%> of women, <S%H2532><s%> nor <S%H802><s%> will he show <S%H3808><s%> regard <S%H995><s%> for any <S%H995><s%> [other] god; <S%H3605><s%> for he will magnify <S%H433><s%> himself above <S%H1431><s%> [them] all. <S%H5921><s%>

"But instead <S%H5921><s%> <S%H3653><s%> he will honor <S%H3513><s%> a god <S%H433><s%> of fortresses, <S%H4581><s%> a god <S%H433><s%> whom <S%H834><s%> his fathers did not know; <S%H1><s%> he will honor <S%H3045><s%> [him] with gold, <S%H3513><s%> silver, <S%H2091><s%> costly <S%H3701><s%> stones, <S%H3368><s%> and treasures. <S%H68><s%>

"And he will take <S%H6213><s%> action <S%H6213><s%> against the strongest <S%H4581><s%> of fortresses <S%H4581><s%> with [the help of] a foreign <S%H5236><s%> god; <S%H433><s%> he will give <S%H7235><s%> great <S%H7235><s%> honor <S%H9202><s%> to those who <S%H834><s%> acknowledge <S%H5234><s%> [him,] and he will cause them to rule <S%H4910><s%> over the many, <S%H7227><s%> and will parcel <S%H2505><s%> out land <S%H127><s%> for a price. <S%H4242><s%>

"And at the end <S%H7093><s%> time <S%H6256><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%> of the South <S%H5045><s%> will collide <S%H5055><s%> with him, and the king <S%H4428><s%> of the North <S%H6828><s%> will storm <S%H9621><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> him with chariots, <S%H7393><s%> with horsemen, <S%H6571><s%> and with many <S%H7227><s%> ships; <S%H591><s%> and he will enter <S%H935><s%> countries, <S%H776><s%> overflow <S%H7857><s%> [them,] and pass <S%H5674><s%> through. <S%H5674><s%>

"He will also enter <S%H935><s%> the Beautiful <S%H9469><s%> Land, <S%H776><s%> and many <S%H7227><s%> [countries] will fall; <S%H3782><s%> but these <S%H428><s%> will be rescued <S%H4422><s%> out of his hand: <S%H3027><s%> Edom, <S%H9000><s%> Moab <S%H4124><s%> and the foremost <S%H7225><s%> of the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Ammon. <S%H5983><s%>
"Then he will stretch <S%H7971><s%> out his hand <S%H3027><s%> against [other] countries, <S%H776><s%> and the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%> will not escape. <S%H6413><s%>

"But he will gain <S%H4910><s%> control <S%H4910><s%> over the hidden <S%H4362><s%> treasures <S%H4362><s%> of gold <S%H2091><s%> and silver, <S%H3701><s%> and over all <S%H3605><s%> the precious <S%H9143><s%> things <S%H9143><s%> of Egypt; <S%H4714><s%> and Libyans <S%H3864><s%> and Ethiopians <S%H3569><s%> [will follow] at his heels. <S%H4703><s%>

"But rumors <S%H8052><s%> from the East <S%H4217><s%> and from the North <S%H6828><s%> will disturb <S%H926><s%> him, and he will go <S%H3318><s%> forth <S%H3318><s%> with great <S%H1419><s%> wrath <S%H2534><s%> to destroy <S%H8045><s%> and annihilate <S%H2763><s%> many. <S%H7227><s%>

"And he will pitch <S%H5193><s%> the tents <S%H168><s%> of his royal <S%H643><s%> pavilion <S%H643><s%> between <S%H996><s%> the seas <S%H3220><s%> and the beautiful <S%H9469><s%> Holy <S%H6944><s%> Mountain; <S%H2022><s%> yet he will come <S%H935><s%> to his end, <S%H7093><s%> and no <S%H369><s%> one <S%H369><s%> will help <S%H5826><s%> him.
